{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Assistant to the Managing Director",
  "description": "Kemslis Pragmatic Limited is a Human Resource Consulting Enterprise that renders services across Recruitment,Training, and Outsourcing

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Managing Director
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Applicant must have a B.SC or HND in any field
	Minimum of 3 years of working experience
	Must be computer literate
	Must have an excellent communication and interpersonal skilll
	Any professional certification would be an added advantage
	Must have a very good written and oral skill.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;kemslisrecruit@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Executive Assistant&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Executive Assistant to the Managing Director Job at Kemslis Pragmatic Limited




        
    

        
        Kemslis Pragmatic Limited is a Human Resource Consulting Enterprise that renders services across Recruitment,Training, and Outsourcing

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Managing Director
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	Applicant must have a B.SC or HND in any field
	Minimum of 3 years of working experience
	Must be computer literate
	Must have an excellent communication and interpersonal skilll
	Any professional certification would be an added advantage
	Must have a very good written and oral skill.


Salary
N300,000 monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using "Executive Assistant" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Civil Engineer",
  "description": "Wagon Wheel Limited, established in 2014, is a leading luxury real estate development company in Africa, specializing in the creation and sale of high-end properties with bespoke interiors, premium finishes, and flexible payment plans. Rooted in the values of accountability, quality, ownership, innovation, and integrity, the company aims to deliver exceptional, fully serviced, move-in-ready homes. With a focus on customer-centric experiences and a strategy combining innovative and traditional business models, Wagon Wheel Ltd ensures peace of mind for its clients. The company is committed to enhancing stakeholder value while providing the finest luxury real estate experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Utako, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary&nbsp;


	This is a full-time, on-site role based in Abuja for the position of Civil Engineer.
	The Civil Engineer will be responsible for designing, planning, and managing civil engineering projects, including tasks related to stormwater management and infrastructure design.
	The role includes collaboration with project teams, evaluating construction plans, ensuring compliance with safety regulations, and developing technical reports.
	The successful candidate will work closely with other engineers, architects, and project managers to deliver high-quality projects in a timely manner.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Civil Engineering or a related field; relevant certifications are a plus
	Proficiency in Civil Engineering Design and expertise in Civil Engineering principles
	Experience in Planning and executing project designs effectively
	Strong knowledge of Stormwater Management systems
	Technical acumen in working as part of a team of Civil Engineers
	Excellent problem-solving and project management skills
	Ability to interpret and analyze technical drawings and specifications
	Familiarity with construction regulations, codes, and legal requirements.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Oluwatomi.tejumade@wagonwheelltd.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Civil Engineer Job at Wagon Wheel Limited




        
    

        
        Wagon Wheel Limited, established in 2014, is a leading luxury real estate development company in Africa, specializing in the creation and sale of high-end properties with bespoke interiors, premium finishes, and flexible payment plans. Rooted in the values of accountability, quality, ownership, innovation, and integrity, the company aims to deliver exceptional, fully serviced, move-in-ready homes. With a focus on customer-centric experiences and a strategy combining innovative and traditional business models, Wagon Wheel Ltd ensures peace of mind for its clients. The company is committed to enhancing stakeholder value while providing the finest luxury real estate experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Location: Utako, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 


	This is a full-time, on-site role based in Abuja for the position of Civil Engineer.
	The Civil Engineer will be responsible for designing, planning, and managing civil engineering projects, including tasks related to stormwater management and infrastructure design.
	The role includes collaboration with project teams, evaluating construction plans, ensuring compliance with safety regulations, and developing technical reports.
	The successful candidate will work closely with other engineers, architects, and project managers to deliver high-quality projects in a timely manner.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field; relevant certifications are a plus
	Proficiency in Civil Engineering Design and expertise in Civil Engineering principles
	Experience in Planning and executing project designs effectively
	Strong knowledge of Stormwater Management systems
	Technical acumen in working as part of a team of Civil Engineers
	Excellent problem-solving and project management skills
	Ability to interpret and analyze technical drawings and specifications
	Familiarity with construction regulations, codes, and legal requirements.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Asset Manager",
  "description": "Phillips Outsourcing Limited has been in existence for over 16 years. We have a vast experience in the outsourcing business as we currently manage resources for major clients in all sectors of the Nigerian economy. In addition, our prolific manpower cuts across the 36 states in Nigeria. After successfully gaining ground in all the 36 states of the federation, we are gradually spreading our tentacles to other African Nations. We are currently registered to also do business in Ghana. Our framework is developed to fully support the businesses of our clients, ensuring continuous improvement of the outsourced services. This ultimately thrusts our clients to achieve their business objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Asset Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Full Time

Job Summary


	The Asset manager shall serve as the strategic and commercial lead for designated upstream and midstream assets.
	The role is responsible for maximizing asset value, production efficiency, and profitability while ensuring full compliance with Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) standards.
	The Asset Manager will integrate technical, financial, and operational disciplines to deliver sustainable asset performance and long-term return on investment.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or related fields
	MSc in Engineering or MBA will be added advantage
	Relevant professional certifications such as CFA, CPA/ACCA, PMP, or equivalent will be preferred
	Minimum of 10 years&rsquo; relevant experience in upstream/midstream asset management or oil &amp; gas operations
	Strong financial modelling and budgeting (CAPEX/OPEX) skills
	Proven ability to assess investment potential and drive profitability
	Experience managing acquisitions, financing, and asset disposition
	Solid understanding of HSE and asset integrity standards
	Strong reporting and presentation skills
	Demonstrated leadership and decision-making ability
	Ability to increase revenue streams and optimize asset performance
	Excellent stakeholder and relationship management skills
	Act as the business lead for assigned upstream and midstream assets.
	Develop and execute asset-specific operational and commercial strategies aligned with corporate objectives.
	Strong financial modelling and valuation skills.
	Budgeting, forecasting, and cost-control expertise.
	Ability to assess investment potential and risk-return profile.
	Knowledge of upstream and midstream operations and commercial structures.
	Seasoned decision-maker with sound commercial judgment.
	Strong analytical and strategic thinking capability.
	Exceptional presentation and relationship management skills.
	High integrity, accountability, and results orientation.
	Ability to build cohesive teams and foster cross-functional collaboration.
	Blend of technical competence, commercial acumen, and leadership presence.


Salary

Asset Manager Job at Phillips Outsourcing Limited




        
    

        
        Phillips Outsourcing Limited has been in existence for over 16 years. We have a vast experience in the outsourcing business as we currently manage resources for major clients in all sectors of the Nigerian economy. In addition, our prolific manpower cuts across the 36 states in Nigeria. After successfully gaining ground in all the 36 states of the federation, we are gradually spreading our tentacles to other African Nations. We are currently registered to also do business in Ghana. Our framework is developed to fully support the businesses of our clients, ensuring continuous improvement of the outsourced services. This ultimately thrusts our clients to achieve their business objectives.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Asset Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	The Asset manager shall serve as the strategic and commercial lead for designated upstream and midstream assets.
	The role is responsible for maximizing asset value, production efficiency, and profitability while ensuring full compliance with Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) standards.
	The Asset Manager will integrate technical, financial, and operational disciplines to deliver sustainable asset performance and long-term return on investment.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or related fields
	MSc in Engineering or MBA will be added advantage
	Relevant professional certifications such as CFA, CPA/ACCA, PMP, or equivalent will be preferred
	Minimum of 10 years’ relevant experience in upstream/midstream asset management or oil & gas operations
	Strong financial modelling and budgeting (CAPEX/OPEX) skills
	Proven ability to assess investment potential and drive profitability
	Experience managing acquisitions, financing, and asset disposition
	Solid understanding of HSE and asset integrity standards
	Strong reporting and presentation skills
	Demonstrated leadership and decision-making ability
	Ability to increase revenue streams and optimize asset performance
	Excellent stakeholder and relationship management skills
	Act as the business lead for assigned upstream and midstream assets.
	Develop and execute asset-specific operational and commercial strategies aligned with corporate objectives.
	Strong financial modelling and valuation skills.
	Budgeting, forecasting, and cost-control expertise.
	Ability to assess investment potential and risk-return profile.
	Knowledge of upstream and midstream operations and commercial structures.
	Seasoned decision-maker with sound commercial judgment.
	Strong analytical and strategic thinking capability.
	Exceptional presentation and relationship management skills.
	High integrity, accountability, and results orientation.
	Ability to build cohesive teams and foster cross-functional collaboration.
	Blend of technical competence, commercial acumen, and leadership presence.


Salary
Negotiable.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Generator Mechanic / Technician",
  "description": "Sterling Oil Exploration and Energy Production Company (SEEPCO) is&nbsp;an Oil Exploration &amp; Energy Production Company Ltd. We are continuously striving to innovate, grow and impact communities around us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Generator Mechanic / Technician
Job Location:&nbsp;Aguu, Imo

Overview


	The Generator Mechanic is responsible for installing, maintaining, troubleshooting, and repairing diesel and gas-powered generators to ensure reliable power supply.
	The role involves mechanical and electrical diagnostics, preventive maintenance, and emergency repair services while ensuring compliance with safety standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Install and commission new generator systems and associated equipment.
	Perform routine preventive maintenance (oil changes, filter replacement, belt inspection, coolant checks).
	Diagnose and repair mechanical and electrical faults.
	Inspect and repair fuel systems, cooling systems, and exhaust systems.
	Monitor generator performance and ensure proper voltage and frequency output.
	Read and interpret technical manuals, wiring diagrams, and schematics.
	Replace defective components such as alternators, starters, batteries, and control modules.
	Maintain accurate service and maintenance records.
	Respond to emergency breakdowns and provide on-site repairs when required.
	Ensure compliance with workplace safety regulations and procedures.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	OND, SSCE, Trade Tests 1, 2, 3
	Proven experience working with diesel or gas generators.
	Strong knowledge of engine systems and mechanicalcontrols.
	Ability to use diagnostic tools and testing equipment.
	Good troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently
	Physical fitness and ability to lift heavy equipment.
	Valid driver&rsquo;s license (if field service is required).


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Mechanical and electrical expertise
	Attention to detail
	Time management skills
	Good communication skills
	Safety-conscious mindset.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to:&nbsp;emeka.uche@energy-mgt.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&quot;Generator Mechanic&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Generator Mechanic / Technician Job at Sterling Oil Exploration and Energy Production Company (SEEPCO)




        
    

        
        Sterling Oil Exploration and Energy Production Company (SEEPCO) is an Oil Exploration & Energy Production Company Ltd. We are continuously striving to innovate, grow and impact communities around us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Generator Mechanic / Technician
Job Location: Aguu, Imo

Overview
     

            
    




	The Generator Mechanic is responsible for installing, maintaining, troubleshooting, and repairing diesel and gas-powered generators to ensure reliable power supply.
	The role involves mechanical and electrical diagnostics, preventive maintenance, and emergency repair services while ensuring compliance with safety standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Install and commission new generator systems and associated equipment.
	Perform routine preventive maintenance (oil changes, filter replacement, belt inspection, coolant checks).
	Diagnose and repair mechanical and electrical faults.
	Inspect and repair fuel systems, cooling systems, and exhaust systems.
	Monitor generator performance and ensure proper voltage and frequency output.
	Read and interpret technical manuals, wiring diagrams, and schematics.
	Replace defective components such as alternators, starters, batteries, and control modules.
	Maintain accurate service and maintenance records.
	Respond to emergency breakdowns and provide on-site repairs when required.
	Ensure compliance with workplace safety regulations and procedures.


Qualifications & Requirements


	OND, SSCE, Trade Tests 1, 2, 3
	Proven experience working with diesel or gas generators.
	Strong knowledge of engine systems and mechanicalcontrols.
	Ability to use diagnostic tools and testing equipment.
	Good troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently
	Physical fitness and ability to lift heavy equipment.
	Valid driver’s license (if field service is required).


Skills & Competencies:


	Mechanical and electrical expertise
	Attention to detail
	Time management skills
	Good communication skills
	Safety-conscious mindset.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: [email protected] using "Generator Mechanic" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Treasury & Cash Operation Officer",
  "description": "Givanas Group is a dynamic and innovative multi-business organization that operates across industries, providing high-quality products and services to customers in West Africa. Givanas also enhances the quality of life for people worldwide by delivering high-quality products and services that enrich their daily experiences. They aspire to be an indispensable part of consumers&rsquo; lives, ensuring that their brands resonate with customers across cultures and geographies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Treasury &amp; Cash Operation&nbsp;Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Eti Osa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department:Finance

About the Role


	Givanas Group is seeking a highly skilledTreasury &amp; Cash Operations Officerto manage daily cash flow, banking transactions, and treasury operations.
	The role ensures optimal liquidity, accurate cash management, and compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor daily cash balances and prepare cash flow forecasts.
	Execute electronic payments, transfers, and reconciliations.
	Track FX rates, execute approved FX transactions, and analyze FX impact.
	Manage petty cash, ensuring proper documentation and approvals.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly treasury and cash reports.
	Ensure all treasury records are audit-ready and compliant with company policies.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements:


	B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in treasury, finance, or account management roles, ideally in FMCG or manufacturing.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, reconciliations, and ERP/accounting systems.
	Professional certifications (ICAN, ACCA) are an advantage.
	Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills.


Key Competencies:


	Treasury &amp; cash management
	Banking &amp; payment operations
	Cash flow forecasting &amp; analysis
	Liquidity &amp; funding management
	Accuracy, accountability, and time management.


Why Join Us


	Be part of a dynamic team in a leading FMCG group, where your expertise will directly impact the company&rsquo;s financial efficiency and growth.

Treasury & Cash Operation Officer Job at Givanas Group




        
    

        
        Givanas Group is a dynamic and innovative multi-business organization that operates across industries, providing high-quality products and services to customers in West Africa. Givanas also enhances the quality of life for people worldwide by delivering high-quality products and services that enrich their daily experiences. They aspire to be an indispensable part of consumers’ lives, ensuring that their brands resonate with customers across cultures and geographies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Treasury & Cash Operation Officer

Job Location: Eti Osa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department:Finance

About the Role
     

            
    




	Givanas Group is seeking a highly skilledTreasury & Cash Operations Officerto manage daily cash flow, banking transactions, and treasury operations.
	The role ensures optimal liquidity, accurate cash management, and compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor daily cash balances and prepare cash flow forecasts.
	Execute electronic payments, transfers, and reconciliations.
	Track FX rates, execute approved FX transactions, and analyze FX impact.
	Manage petty cash, ensuring proper documentation and approvals.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly treasury and cash reports.
	Ensure all treasury records are audit-ready and compliant with company policies.


Qualifications & Requirements:


	B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
	3–5 years of experience in treasury, finance, or account management roles, ideally in FMCG or manufacturing.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, reconciliations, and ERP/accounting systems.
	Professional certifications (ICAN, ACCA) are an advantage.
	Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills.


Key Competencies:


	Treasury & cash management
	Banking & payment operations
	Cash flow forecasting & analysis
	Liquidity & funding management
	Accuracy, accountability, and time management.


Why Join Us


	Be part of a dynamic team in a leading FMCG group, where your expertise will directly impact the company’s financial efficiency and growth.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
